document.docAuthor: Martins, Luciano De P., Da Silva, Luciene G., Henriques, Augusto L. & Zefa, Edison
document.masterDocTitle: First record of the genera Luzarida Hebard, 1928 and Luzaridella Desutter- Grandcolas, 1992 (Orthoptera, Gryllidae, Phalangopsinae) from Brazil, including a new species and description of the female of Luzarida lata Gorochov, 2011

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: First record of the genera Luzarida Hebard, 1928 and Luzaridella Desutter- Grandcolas, 1992 (Orthoptera, Gryllidae, Phalangopsinae) from Brazil, including a new species and description of the female of Luzarida lata Gorochov, 2011

subSubSection.paragraph:
Luzarida lata Gorochov, 2011 : 1060
[
Figs. 1
(10, 11), 5 ( 1–3 )]. Type locality:
Guyana
, “British
Guyana
, New River, 750 ft .”. Holotype in NHM, not examined.

Additional observations in males. Subgenital plate with v-shaped margin. Stridulatory file of right tegmen with 68–74 teeth (n= 6 ). Left tegmen without stridulatory file. Genitalia showed at
Figs. 14–16
.

Comments. Among
Luzarida
species only
L. recondita
has some information about their calling song (Nischk & Otte 2000 ). The song of this species differs in several aspects from
L. lata
remarkably in the pattern that pulses are emitted varying stretches of brief and long trills (from 16–20 pulses in brief trills to 350–400 pulses in long trills), pulse rate emitted very faster (from 107.6 to 125.5 pulses/s), and lower dominant frequency, about 2.2 kHz.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 17–23. Calling perches of
Luzarida lata
and spectrograms of
L. lata
and
Luzaridella susurra
sp. nov. 17 —Male of
L. lata
stridulating in the trunk of a tree, positioned perpendicular to the ground; 18 —Male of
L. lata
stridulating in a ravine on dry leaves; 19–22 —spectrograms of
L. lata
; 19 —pulses almost regularly separated; 20 —pulses irregularly separated but without clear groups; 21 —pulses irregularly separated forming groups of four pulses (1+3); 22 —transition between a calling song section with pulses irregularly separated forming groups of three and four pulses (a) and section with pulses irregularly separated but without clear groups (b); 23 —spectrogram with three phrases of
L. susurra
sp. nov paratype.
